docs.lead_paragraph: When an electorate is red-faced and fist-clenched, when the collective national blood pressure is 160 over 100, when the big issues of the day are mired in tired minds, it's time to turn to the great, renewable resource of any vibrant democracy: the kids. The millennials, that echo boomer generation born after 1982, have not been heard from of late, ever since proving that they could pull away from their Facebook pages long enough to help elect a president.
docs.abstract: Timothy Egan Op-Ed article marvels at recent survey results showing that post-1982 millennial generation has retained its trademark confidence, involvement and flexibility despite country's state of affairs; urges Pres Obama to recognize generation ready to be roused; suggests calling on their sense of service, desire for change and belief in restoration to form millennial corps of workers project that could start with gulf oil spill cleanup
docs.snippet: When an electorate is red-faced and fist-clenched, when the collective national blood pressure is 160 over 100, when the big issues of the day are mired in tired minds, it's time to turn to the great, renewable resource of any vibrant democracy: the...

docs.lead_paragraph: When an electorate is red-faced and fist-clenched, when the collective national blood pressure is 160 over 100, when the big issues of the day are mired in tired minds, it's time to turn to the great, renewable resource of any vibrant democracy: the kids.
docs.abstract: The youth vote turned out in droves to help elect President Obama in 2008. Will they show up for the midterms?
docs.snippet: The youth vote turned out in droves to help elect President Obama in 2008. Will they show up for the midterms?

docs.lead_paragraph: Earlier this week Clifford J. Levy wrote about Julian MacKay and Joy Womack. The two budding ballet dancers are among a small group of Americans who have ever trained at the prestigious and competitive Bolshoi academy in Moscow. We asked readers to submit questions to the two dancers. Here is the first round of responses.

headline.main: Ask the Dancers: Young Americans in Russia Respond

docs.abstract: We asked readers to submit questions to the two dancers. Here is the first round of responses.
docs.snippet: We asked readers to submit questions to the two dancers. Here is the first round of responses.

headline.main: How Will We Pay for Insurance?

docs.abstract: Medicaid will cover many more adults beginning in 2014, and the new exchanges will provide subsidies to help make premiums more affordable.

docs.lead_paragraph: The president said it was time “to aggressively accelerate” the nation’s transition from oil to alternative energy sources.

docs.lead_paragraph: At least 11 states have passed laws this year regulating abortion, and in four additional states, bills have passed at least one house of the legislature.

docs.lead_paragraph: A report is used to show that Americans could save while maintaining quality, but that may not always hold.

headline.seo: Data Used to Justify Health Savings Effort  Is Sometimes Shaky
headline.main: Critics Question Study Cited in Health Debate

byline.original: By REED ABELSON and GARDINER HARRIS

docs.lead_paragraph: The Dartmouth Atlas of Health Care mines Medicare data to identify variations in hospital spending around the country. Dartmouth researchers sometimes argue that the highest-spending regions — those in the darkest color — tend to have the worst health care.
docs.snippet: The Dartmouth Atlas of Health Care mines Medicare data to identify variations in hospital spending around the country. Dartmouth researchers sometimes argue that the highest-spending regions — those in the darkest color — tend to have the worst...

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama on Wednesday extended a modest package of benefits to the same-sex partners of federal employees, a move that will make them eligible for day care, travel and relocation allowances, employee assistance programs and, in some cases, enable them to inherit retirement benefits.
docs.abstract: President Obama laments that he legally cannot do more while increasing some benefits for federal employees.
docs.snippet: President Obama laments that he legally cannot do more while increasing some benefits for federal employees.

headline.main: Will Insurance Be Given to Those Who Can't Afford It?

docs.abstract: Private insurance will not be provided directly to those who cannot afford to pay for it, but in 2014 there should be more options available.
docs.snippet: Private insurance will not be provided directly to those who cannot afford to pay for it, but in 2014 there should be more options available.
